com.cmput301w17t07.moody

Class AchievementManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cmput301w17t07.moody.AchievementManager

  • public class AchievementManager
extends java.lang.Object
    AchievementManager class object. Handles the saving and loading of the achievements model object. for the Moody application. Structure and code of this class follows Abram Hindle's Studentpicker tutorial video series as seen here:
    Author: Abram Hindle
    Date: Sep. 11, 2014
    Link: www.youtube.com/watch?v=5PPD0ncJU1g&list=PL240uJOh_Vb4PtMZ0f7N8ACYkCLv0673O
    Used By: Michael Simion (March 31, 2017)

    • Method Detail

      • initManager

        public static void initManager(android.content.Context context)
        This is the initialization method. It constructs a new Achievement manager object if one does not already exist. It is called in any activity where achievements are updated/saved.
        Parameters:
        context -

        public static AchievementManager getManager()

      • loadAchievements

        public Achievements loadAchievements()
                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                     java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        loadAchievements method is used to load the achievements that are stored in the phones internal storage. Following implementation detailed by Abram Hindle in video referenced above
        Returns:
        Achievements object
        Throws:

        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException -
